urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG

urls.title: South Africa‚Äôs 'Deadly Air' Case Highlights Health Risks from Coal
urls.description: When you approach the town of Secunda in the coal-rich province of Mpumalanga in eastern South Africa, the toxic smell of air emanating from the cluster of coal-fired power stations hits you long-before before you see the town.

tweets.text: @WasteCrimeWatch @DeniseO97662017 @EnvAgency There is no way this community will put up with this for another 5 years trust me we're at breaking point now . @BorisJohnson @MattHancock @DefraGovUK you REALLY need to step up to the plate now before we crack .

@Martinpedalman @davemh72 @SOPH_C_ @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids They have to be careful not to appear political, tho I think they have said they can't do more monitoring for this reason. I'd be more convinced, only this really isn't the only case like it in the UK - there's a systematic failure, of which NuL is the worst case.

@BenM_Anderson @davemh72 @SOPH_C_ @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids Pretty sure thats correct but they were not twice as effective 10 years ago either - if they are not directing the funding they do have to issues like this then what are their priorities ?? If lack of enforcement is due to lack of funding then say that so the debate can be had üëç

tweets.text: @HelenVi00175623 @SianieRoo @Martinpedalman @davemh72 @SOPH_C_ @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @BorisJohnson @MPGeorgeEustice @Cap_it_off I'd say this is 100% the case at this point. @Martinpedalman @davemh72 @SOPH_C_ @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids The EA is underfunded and underpowered. I'm pretty sure they are doing as much as they can, but if you've had your funding cut in half over a decade, it's not that surprising that you aren't as effective. I agree that it's not fit for purpose - I just think that is by design.

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP
